info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:35PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Anderson and southwestern Pickens Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 835 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northeast of Seneca to 4 miles southwest of Clemson to 8 miles north of Hartwell. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clemson, Central, Williamston, Pendleton, Liberty, Norris, Northlake, Six Mile and Sandy Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for Upstate South Carolina.
